newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - Oct 22.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - President Lee Teng-hui says Taiwan and China should stop their current hostile confrontation.
The government steps up efforts to gather criminal evidence in its anti-gangster sweep.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Teachers and government employees will see a salary increase of three percent next year.
Prosecutors investigate Tainan mayor Shih Chih-ming for possible corruption.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Taiwan's unemployment rate will reach a new high next year, the government says.
Export orders in September set a new monthly high.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - The Taiwan dollar falls to T$27.5 versus one U.S. dollar.
Taiwan will speed up the pace of economic recovery next year.
